p: With traditional seasonal flu vaccine human immunity wanes in 6–8 months of time, enough to last through the influenza season [ 96, 97]. But if a universal vaccine were to break the cycle of yearly vaccinations, long-term protection will be needed. Having durable protection for at least 1 year and preferably through multiple seasons is one of the four criteria set by the NIAID for a universal influenza vaccine [ 87], but how to achieve that goal is still unknown. Immunization schedules, formulations, dosages, and adjuvants will all likely have to be considered.
